page.title: 13St.John's Ambulance Brigade
page.content:
Opposite Gt.Ryburgh School is St.John's Hall, a former blacksmith's shop and seed store, bought for the use of the St.John's Ambulance Brigade by Sir Thomas Cook of Sennowe Park, a lifelong supporter of the movement. Today it is cheaper to hire the school than heat the hall for meetings, which are attended weekly by 18 children aged 8 to 16 for instruction in First Aid, Home Nursing, Fire Prevention, Road and Home Safety, Cooking and Nutrition, Animal Care and Camp Craft. Their volunteer instructor, Harry Plattin from Great Ryburgh takes them to a Summer Camp at Northrepps each year. The members each pay a subscription of ten pence per week.
{(See also page 3)
